intro: Calamintha piperelloides, commonly known as sweet cicely, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill. The plant features slender, aromatic stems and small white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a delicate, spicy scent. Calamintha piperelloides is often grown for its ornamental value and historical use in herbal medicine.
